intro: Christisonia albida, commonly known as the white-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
